speaker: Viral image
vclaim: "In 1921, early elections were often without a bathing suit and eating pizza in large groups to disturb men... they were usually at the time."
date: stated on June 6, 2019 in a Facebook post:
title: No, early ballots didn't eat pizza in bathing suits to bother men.
text: Women can be very annoying, talk about voting rights, complain about equal pay and beat up some "za" to provoke men. Or so she claims that a recent Facebook article contains a black and white picture of women who eat. "In 1921," read the article June 6, "The early voters often don't wear a swimsuit and eat pizza in large groups to disturb men... it was usually at the time." This article was referred to as part of Facebook's efforts to combat false news and misleading information in its news broadcast. ∙ (Read more about our partnership with Facebook.) This is because the picture from 1921, but it shows a pie-eating contest in Washington, D.C., not an overwhelming act of protest. You can find the picture on the Library of Congress under the title "The Cookie Eating Competition, Bathing Beach, [7/21/31]." The photograph was created on July 31, 1921, and was presented by the National Photography Company Group, which, according to the Library of Congress, "documented almost all aspects of Washington, D.C., Life." Facebook was published on January 11, 2021 in Facebook, Nancy Belusi, who was no longer the Speaker of the House of Representatives by Samantha Buterman. January 12, 2021, a clearer version of the picture appears on Shorpy, a website entitled "Archive historic American photos" selling literature. The site also states that the photograph was taken on 31 July of that year during the pie contest at Tidal Basin Beach. We have not been able to find any credible reports of people eating pizza to disturb men - although the allegation appeared on Twitter, Reddit and Prentiss, among other websites - and certainly not in 1921. By that time, women had obtained voting rights. In 1920, the 19th Amendment was ratified, guaranteeing all American women the possibility to vote. We're categorizing this article on Facebook as wrong.
